pageContext.description: The central part of the blade-edge and mouth of socket missing. The whole is bent into a curved shape, and the lower part is considerably crushed. On one face of the blade are four ribs, the central ones pointed, the extreme ones terminating in a round boss: on the other side (which is crushed on the ribs partly obliterated) these appear to have been five ribs, the extreme and the central one terminating in a round boss, the second and fourth pointed. Remains of wood in socket.
pageContext.patina: Green with a little brown patina.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for first socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Jessup, Arch of Kent, 107,Evans,Journ. Anhtop. Inst. III, 230.
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on line of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NW by N of summit of hill.,Found June 4, 1872
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
